DataElement.preferredName: BRCAPRO Claus Model Risk Assessment Percentage Number Decimal Result
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric result expressed as a percentage that reflects the result of a person's 5-year risk of developing breast cancer as predicted by BRCAPRO implementation of the Claus Model.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A statistical model used to assess the probability that an individual carries a germline deleterious mutation of the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes, based on family history of breast and ovarian cancer, including male breast cancer and bilateral synchronous and asynchronous diagnoses.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A statistical model used to assess the probability that an individual carries a germline deleterious mutation of the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes, based on family history of breast and ovarian cancer, including male breast cancer and bilateral synchronous and asynchronous diagnoses. :The Claus model predicts the probability of a woman's risk for developing breast cancer based on her family history. It focuses solely on family history to estimate the probability that a woman will develop breast cancer. Using this model requires providing information about first-degree and second-degree relatives who have had breast cancer. It factors in the ages at which these relatives were diagnosed. It can also include breast cancer history on the father's side of the family as well. It's main advantage is its expanded inclusion of family history information. It is limited in that it can be used only with women who have at least one first- or second-degree relative with breast cancer. Also, it does not take into account other risk factors such as the presence of atypical hyperplasia, age of first menstrual period, or age of first live birth.

Concepts.definition: A statistical model used to assess the probability that an individual carries a germline deleterious mutation of the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes, based on family history of breast and ovarian cancer, including male breast cancer and bilateral synchronous and asynchronous diagnoses.

The Claus model predicts the probability of a woman's risk for developing breast cancer based on her family history. It focuses solely on family history to estimate the probability that a woman will develop breast cancer. Using this model requires providing information about first-degree and second-degree relatives who have had breast cancer. It factors in the ages at which these relatives were diagnosed. It can also include breast cancer history on the father's side of the family as well. It's main advantage is its expanded inclusion of family history information. It is limited in that it can be used only with women who have at least one first- or second-degree relative with breast cancer. Also, it does not take into account other risk factors such as the presence of atypical hyperplasia, age of first menstrual period, or age of first live birth.

Property.preferredDefinition: The qualitative or quantitative estimation of the likelihood of adverse effects that may result from exposure to specified health hazards or from the absence of beneficial influences.

Concepts.definition: An estimated probability that one or more adverse event(s) will occur as a result of exposure to an actual or potential hazardous situation or chemical.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric result expressed as a percent that reflects the result of a person's risk assessment evaluation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The qualitative or quantitative estimation of the likelihood of adverse effects that may result from exposure to specified health hazards or from the absence of beneficial influences.:Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: An estimated probability that one or more adverse event(s) will occur as a result of exposure to an actual or potential hazardous situation or chemical.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
